meta.theme: Identity, Control, and The Ethics of Power
meta.timeline_deviation: Lucas, an amnesiac with the powers of Amon (Lord of the Mysteries), appears in Brockton Bay and joins the Wards.
meta.title: The Error of Wormverse

status.age_discrepancy: Biologically 22, passing as ~17 for Wards eligibility via unconscious Time Theft/Deceit.

civilian.cover_story: Dean Stansfield's distant cousin from England. Eccentric but harmless.

status.reputation: Hero who prioritizes safety over arrests

civilian.name: Lucas
civilian.costume_description: Casual clothes, often wears a monocle he 'found'.
civilian.cover_story: Amnesiac Case 53 victim with no physical mutations, age assessed as 17 by PRT (likely due to unconscious Time Theft/Deceit).

hero.name: (Pending - likely 'Crow' or 'Error' related)
hero.costume_description: Classic sleek suit with a monocle motif or a stylized robe (User to define).

character_sheet.name: Lucas

powers.core_ability: The Error Pathway (Lord of the Mysteries)
powers.summary: Conceptual manipulation of Theft, Deceit, Time, and Parasitism. Can steal physical objects, thoughts, powers, and even abstract concepts like distance or fate.
limitations: Mental stability (risk of madness at high output)
Needs to understand the 'logic' to exploit it effectively

Director_Piggot.dynamics: Authority. Piggot distrusts him due to 'Case 53' status and high power ratings.

Vista.dynamics: Mentee. Successfully applied Lucas's 'folded space' theory in combat; sees him as the only one who understands her power's potential.

Armsmaster.dynamics: Suspects the 'illness' might be related to power overuse or the Simurgh, but accepts the excuse to protect the asset.

Clockblocker.dynamics: Unknowingly targeted. Lucas views him as a resource for the 'Stasis' concept needed for the cure.

Director Piggot.dynamics: Terrified reliance. She believes Lucas is the only early warning system for a Simurgh plot.

Gallant.dynamics: Terrified. Dean looked into Lucas's mind (or the lack thereof) and felt the 'deep well'. He is afraid but polite.

Tattletale.dynamics: Wary complicity. She knows Lucas intends to permanently strip a villain's powers (Kill Order behavior) but provided the target anyway.

Undersiders.dynamics: Hostile. Lucas embarrassed them at the Bank, forcing a retreat. Tattletale is wary of his 'anti-logic' abilities.

The Wards ENE.dynamics: Concerned but distant. They believe Lucas is suffering a medical episode and are giving him space, reinforcing his 'frail' cover story.

Aegis.dynamics: Life Debt established. Lucas saved him from certain death.

Shadow_Stalker.dynamics: Tense. She views Lucas as 'strong' but weird. He views her as an inefficiency and a bully. Likely to clash over methodology.

Kid Win.dynamics: Empowered. Chris feels validated and capable after Lucas's intervention with the Alternator Cannon.

Shadow Stalker.dynamics: Awed submission. Witnesses Lucas's absolute dominance and violation of the 'game' rules, accepting him as the true Apex Predator.

Miss Militia.dynamics: Protective. She helps him prepare, seeing him as a traumatized child soldier.

Dragon.dynamics: Complicit Observer. She witnesses Lucas's possession of stolen evidence but allows it for the greater good/Colin's sake.

Victoria Dallon.dynamics: Sympathetic. Sees Lucas as a 'civilian casualty' of the cape world who needs cheering up.

Amy Dallon.dynamics: Protective. Amy is actively defending 'frail' Lucas from social pressure, cementing her role as his caretaker in her own mind.

Dean Stansfield.dynamics: Relieved but wary. Impressed by Lucas's social camouflage but terrified of the underlying predator.

Carol Dallon.dynamics: Suspicious scrutiny. Doubts his cover story details but tolerates him for Dean/Amy's sake.

Thomas Calvert.dynamics: Hunter/Prey. Lucas has visually identified Coil and confirmed his identity via 'Theft of Anonymity' (internal logic). Calvert is unaware he has been made.

Legend.dynamics: Mutual understanding of the 'Performance'. Legend sees a kindred spirit in the burden of being a symbol.

Public.dynamics: Desperate adoration. They are projecting their need for a savior onto Lucas after Scion's failure.

Skidmark.dynamics: Emboldened. Views his escape as a victory over heroes.

Trickster.dynamics: Reluctant subordination. Lucas forced him into a 'Hero' role to use public opinion as a shield against Coil.

Sundancer.dynamics: Concerned. Saw Lucas collapse after trying to help them; reinforces her belief he is their only hope.

Coil.dynamics: Undermined. His primary assets (Travelers) are now compromised.

Alexandria.dynamics: High-Stakes Negotiation. She views him as an anomaly to be dissected or recruited; he views her as a peer to be managed.

Leet.dynamics: Terrified. Lucas stole a conceptual copy of his power's restriction.

Noelle.dynamics: Lucas views her as a 'Library' of code rather than a person. She feels safe but 'quiet' without the Simurgh's song.

Overtake.dynamics: Neutralized. Power permanently stolen; mind fractured by the forced administrative transfer.

character_sheet.description: A polite, reserved young man of 22 (posing as ~17) with a mysterious monocle habit. He seeks stability but wields the terrifying conceptual power of 'The Error'.

canon_techniques.name: Conceptual Theft
canon_techniques.description: Stealing abstract concepts like 'Distance' (teleportation), 'Thoughts' (stun/amnesia), 'Time' (aging), or 'Fate' (identity replacement).

canon_techniques.name: Bug / Error Creation
canon_techniques.description: Exploiting logical contradictions to negate attacks (e.g., 'The attack hit my avatar, not me') or bypass seals (e.g., 'This door is actually open').
A distributed network of consciousness across thousands of bodies (Worms of Time). Any avatar can become the Main Body instantly.
canon_techniques.name: Avatar Swarm / Parasitism

canon_techniques.description: Summons a phantom clock to steal time duration from spells or age targets.
canon_techniques.name: Clock Phantom

weaknesses_and_counters: Corruption feedback from stealing Cursed Fates
Attacks on the 'Main Body' (difficult to distinguish)

canon_scene_examples.power_used: Theft of Thought & Game of Chicken
canon_scene_examples.opponent_or_context: Klein Moretti (The Fool) in Sefirah Castle
canon_scene_examples.how_deployed: Amon constantly stole Klein's thoughts (intentions to attack/defend), making Klein 'forget' to resist. Klein countered by grafting his thoughts to unrelated concepts.
canon_scene_examples.outcome: Amon conceded when Klein gambled on awakening the Celestial Worthy (mutual erasure), proving Amon's fear of losing his identity.

canon_scene_examples.how_deployed: Amon stole the 'distance' between himself and the target to bypass kiting/teleportation. He also stole the 'time' of the journey to disorient the target.
canon_scene_examples.scene: The Chase in the Forsaken Land of Gods
canon_scene_examples.outcome: Klein was trapped in a psychological cage where escape attempts were conceptually stolen before execution.
Pallez was drained and dropped to Sequence 2; Amon reclaimed the characteristic.
canon_scene_examples.how_deployed: Amon placed a Sequence 1 characteristic as bait. When Pallez arrived, Amon used Door authority to seal the space and harvested the characteristic.

sources.combat_style: Conceptual Saboteur - steals enemy options (thoughts, distance, time) and creates logical 'bugs' to bypass defenses. Uses avatar swarms for distributed consciousness. Risk-averse but sadistic.

Alternator_Cannon.origin: Built during a 2-week period of intense focus facilitated by medication (Ritalin equivalent).
Alternator_Cannon.description: 15-foot modular energy weapon. Overkill for most situations.

April_2011.notes: Views self as failing generalist Tinker; on probation for budget issues.
April_2011.specialty_status: Unrealized (Believes he is a gun/beam tinker)

limitations: Dyscalculia makes math-heavy tinkering difficult without medication or intuitive leaps.
Needs to constantly swap parts/reconfigure to satisfy shard.

Taylor_Hebert.dynamics: Victim/Prey. Obsessed with proving Taylor is weak.

The_Wards.dynamics: Disdainful. Views them as soft. Bullies Vista. Tension with all members.

Shadow_Stalker.description: Tall, athletic, dark-skinned teenage girl. Aggressive and confrontational. Wears a grey and black costume with a hood and mask.

personality.motivation: Validation of superiority, hatred of weakness/losing
personality.notes: Views laws as a lie. Believes the strong should take what they want. deeply influenced by an aggressive shard.

Shadow_Stalker.name: Shadow Stalker

powers.limitations: Electricity disrupts her state, causing spasms and forcing her solid. Strong shocks can be debilitating.
powers.summary: Can shift into a lightweight 'shadow' state. Phase through solid objects. Extend phasing to weapons (bolts).

Assault.canon_accuracy: Prankster nature is canon, but 'Kill Order' prank is FANON (False). Canon prank: Giving Weaver a closet for an office. Former villain 'Madcap'.
Assault.personality: The 'Cool Uncle'. Joker, slack-off, flirtatious with Battery. Prankster. Protective of kids.
Assault.powers: Kinetic Energy Manipulation (Striker). Absorbs kinetic energy from impacts (making him durable) and redirects it into strikes or super-jumps.
Assault.name: Assault

relationships.Battery: Wife/Partner. He chased her (as Madcap) until she agreed to date him. Loves her deeply despite the teasing.
relationships.Wards: Teases them (especially Vista/Clockblocker) but is very protective in danger.

Battery.powers: Charge-System (Breaker/Mover). Spends time 'charging' to unleash bursts of super speed, strength, and invulnerability. Minor electromagnetic manipulation.
Battery.name: Battery
Battery.personality: The 'Stern Aunt'. Professional, by-the-book, easily exasperated by Assault but loves him.

relationships.Assault: Husband/Partner. Originally hated him (he was the villain Madcap), but he wore her down.
relationships.Cauldron: Client. Owes them favors for her powers.

Battery.canon_accuracy: Bought powers from Cauldron to catch Madcap (Assault).

Bakuda.description: Young woman, likely half-Asian. Wears a heavy costume with a gas mask and synthesized voice. Obsessed with proving her intelligence.

powers.summary: Creation of bombs with non-standard physics effects. Can transmute matter, warp time/space, alter gravity, and freeze targets. Effects are often widely varied and unpredictable to victims.
powers.limitations: Bombs require preparation. She is physically normal (human durability). Gas mask is a weak point. Ego makes her monologue.

personality.notes: Failed out of Cornell (implied). Massive inferiority complex masked by megalomania. Treats combat like a lecture.
personality.mindset: Terror is the only currency. I am the smartest person in the room.

Lung.dynamics: Fear/Respect but plotting to surpass him. She thinks she's smarter, he knows he's stronger.

Undersiders.dynamics: Hatred. They embarrassed her (or she wants to break them).

Oni_Lee.dynamics: Dismissive. Sees him as a drone.

Bakuda.name: Bakuda

complete_member_roster.name: Kenta
complete_member_roster.powers: Dragon escalation (Pyrokinesis/Brute/Regen). Gets stronger the longer he fights.
Teleportation clones (Leave behind explosive ash clones).
complete_member_roster.name: Unknown
Unknown
complete_member_roster.powers: Tinker 6 (Bomb Specialty). Creates varied effects (Time, Gravity, Transmutation, Pain).
complete_member_roster.typical_activities: Terrorism, bomb making, holding the city hostage
complete_member_roster.typical_equipment: Gas mask, Grenade launcher, Dead man's switch

ABB.description: Asian gang (Azn Bad Boys). Violent, controls the Docks/northern areas.

The_Wards_ENE.description: Youth branch of the PRT. Heroes under 18.
The_Wards_ENE.living_situation: Most live at home; Lucas lives on The Rig (Case 53 protocol).

Empire_Eighty_Eight.description: Neo-Nazi organization. Largest gang in the city. Ties to international organization (Gesellschaft).

Cauldron.description: Shadowy conspiracy engineering the 'Game' to save the world.

The_Boardwalk.description: Tourist area with shops and pier. Safer during the day, dangerous at night.

The_Docks.description: Industrial waterfront, abandoned warehouses, ship graveyard. High crime, poverty.

Clarendon.description: Middle-class commercial district. Heavy E88 presence, disguised as legitimate businesses.

The_Rig.description: PRT Headquarters. An offshore oil rig converted into a base. Connected to shore by forcefield bridge.

Lord_Street_Market.description: Open air market in the Docks. Shady dealings, stalls selling grey market goods.

Winslow_High.description: Worst high school in the city. Territory lines drawn in hallways. Taylor Hebert attends here.

Downtown.description: Financial district and city center. Cleanest part of the city. Heavy hero presence.

Brockton_Bay_General.description: A city on the northeast coast of the US. Historically a major shipping hub, now in economic decline and plagued by parahuman gangs.

The_Loft.description: Undersiders' hideout. A converted loft apartment in the Docks/industrial area. High ceilings, large windows covered up.
The_Loft.name: The Loft

limitations.text: Most powers still obey some laws of physics or conservation of energy (unlike LotM magic).
Many 'Striker' powers require direct skin contact and cannot work through clothing unless the user's self-concept extends to their gear.

core_rules.name: Trigger Events
core_rules.text: Powers manifest during moments of extreme trauma, mental stress, or physical danger.

core_rules.name: The Manton Limit
core_rules.text: Safety restrictor for powers. 1) Organic vs Inorganic: Powers usually affect one or the other (e.g., telekinesis lifts cars but slides off people). 2) Internal Protection: Powers cannot manifest inside living bodies (anti-telefragging). 3) Self-Protection: Users are immune to their own power's direct effects (e.g., pyrokinesis user doesn't burn).

core_rules.name: Conflict Drive
core_rules.text: Shards subtly push users toward conflict to gather data. This encourages the 'Cops and Robbers' dynamic.

Wormverse.power_scaling: Street Tier to City Tier (standard). Endbringers are Continent Tier. Scion is Planetary/Universal.

taboos: No Civilian Attacks (Don't attack at home/work).
No Rape/Sexual Assault (Results in severe punishment by all sides).
No Bio-Tinkering (Creating uncontrolled life is an S-Class risk).
No Mastering normal humans into crimes/suicide.
unwritten_rules.description: The 'Cops and Robbers' game. A social contract to keep conflict survivable.

master_stranger.description: Used when fighting mind-controllers (Masters) or perception-alterers (Strangers).
rules: Eyes On: Never leave line of sight.
Trust No One: Assume compromise if out of character.
M-K Authorization: Lethal force authorized on compromised allies if necessary.

s_class_threat.criteria: Self-replicating powers, exponential growth, threat to humanity (e.g., Nilbog, Endbringers).
s_class_threat.response: Strategic weapons (nukes), absolute priority, kill on sight.

tier_2_kill_order.criteria: S-Class threats, Slaughterhouse Nine, breaking Endbringer Truce.
tier_2_kill_order.effect: Suspension of 'Hero' non-lethality. Bounty posted. Any citizen authorized to kill.

tier_1_birdcage.criteria: Too dangerous for prison, repeated escapes, severe crimes (mass murder).
tier_1_birdcage.nature: Inescapable prison in a mountain. No parole. One-way trip.

rules: Crimes committed before the battle are ignored during the battle (Amnesty).
endbringer_truce.penalties: Kill Order for breaking the truce.

Lucas_Powers_Amon_Model.combat_behavior: Steals abilities or thoughts mid-combat. Parasitizes targets (animals/humans). Swarms with avatars. Exploits logical loopholes.
canon_techniques: Parasitism (Worms of Time - Concealed or Controlling)
Deceit & Error (Creating 'bugs' in reality, Logic Distortion)
Lucas_Powers_Amon_Model.usage_style: Thrill-seeking. Creates 'bugs' to bypass defenses. Uses 'Theft' to steal abstract concepts like distance or anchors.
Lucas_Powers_Amon_Model.visual_signature: Crystal monocle on right eye, pointed wizard hat, black robes. Reaching motion for theft.
Lucas_Powers_Amon_Model.weaknesses: Uniqueness conflicts. Risk-averse (flees if main body threatened). Concealment powers counter him.

key_events: Leviathan strikes with massive tidal wave.
Battle in flooded streets; Armsmaster sacrifices E88 members.
Armsmaster fails solo duel; Skitter discovers betrayal.
Leviathan targets shelter; Bitch's dogs slaughtered.
Scion arrives and forces Leviathan's retreat.
brockton_bay_leviathan_battle.outcome: Leviathan retreats. Aquifer cracked (city sinking). Armsmaster disgraced (rebranded Defiant).
brockton_bay_leviathan_battle.armsmaster_betrayal: Armsmaster used combat prediction software to set up villains (Kaiser, Fenja) as sacrifices to trap Leviathan. Attempted to solo Leviathan with Nanothorn Halberd. Failed when Halberd could not cut core density.

leviathan_mechanics.core_mechanics: Located in trunk. Layers of body become exponentially denser (Steel -> Tungsten -> Boron) towards the center. Core acts as a portal to a high-density dimension, negating atomic severing attacks.
leviathan_mechanics.after_echo: 'Water Shadow'. When Leviathan moves, the space he vacates fills with water retaining his velocity and mass, hitting with the density of concrete.
leviathan_mechanics.tactics: Hit-and-run, erodes foundations to sink landmasses, uses tidal waves every few minutes.

endbringer_protocols.truce_rules: Universal ceasefire between Heroes and Villains. Villains granted amnesty during the fight. No 'game' behavior (stealing/killing rivals). Violators get a Kill Order.
endbringer_protocols.armbands: Dragon-tech devices distributed to all capes. Functions: GPS tracking, vital sign monitoring, 'Dead Man's Switch', and voice announcements for status updates (e.g., 'Down', 'Deceased').
endbringer_protocols.sirens: Global alarm (distant pattern) vs. Local alarm (distinct air-raid style).

target_classes.soft_targets: Blasters/Shakers for damage, kept in backlines

nanothorn_halberd.effect: Cloud of nanomachines on blade edge severs atomic bonds, theoretically cutting through anything.
nanothorn_halberd.limitations: Failed against Leviathan's hyper-dense core layers; the density 'clogged' or shattered the effect.

error_pathway_mechanics.limitations: Requires a logical framework to create a 'Bug'. Cannot easily parasitize equal-level beings without weakening them first.

abilities.seq_1_worm_of_time: Time Manipulation, Time Theft, Time Gifting, Restart.
abilities.seq_0_error: Absolute Deception, Conceptual Theft, Bug Exploitation, Avatar Unification.
abilities.seq_2_trojan_horse: Fate Theft, Identity Theft, Parasitizing Sealed Artifacts.

topics_they_avoid: the true extent of his power.
Lucas.emotional_tells: Maintains absolute stillness to unsettle Empaths.
dialogue_examples: I do not manipulate the molecules. I access the object's properties and change the value to zero.
Are you pleasantly surprised?
Don't ask us why we're taking such risks. Life often requires some excitement, joy, and anticipation.
I suddenly have a feeling that directly replacing you would result in something I don't wish to see happening.
Humans nowadays are really lacking in creativity. Next time, I'll steal the cathedral in front of them.
Miracles are only for a moment, but fate is often a long-lasting event.
I won't lose too much, just myself.
speech_patterns: and terrifying. Often refers to self as 'We' (referring to avatars) or switches between 'I' and 'We'. Layers lies within truths.
verbal_tics: Habitually pinches or nudges a crystal monocle on his right eye when amused
Lucas.personality: Thrill-seeker who views life as a game. Deceitful, seeks excitement and joy, but is coldly rational and risk-averse regarding his own survival. Treats enemies as toys.

dialogue_examples: Efficiency is paramount. We do not have time for errors.
Armsmaster.emotional_tells: Becomes quieter and more rigid when angry. Clenches jaw.
speech_patterns: technical. Avoids slang. Uses military/police terminology.

Director_Piggot.emotional_tells: Face turns red, voice drops to a growl.
dialogue_examples: I will not have my city turned into a warzone by children in spandex.

Vista.emotional_tells: Flinches when age is mentioned, relaxes when treated seriously.
dialogue_examples: I think you're weird... but you don't look at me like I'm a kid.

Gallant.emotional_tells: Visibly anxious (aura), avoids eye contact when unsettled.
dialogue_examples: You... you don't feel anything
do you? I can't read you.
Predator and prey
that's how the world works. You're just meat waiting to be eaten.
Shadow_Stalker.emotional_tells: Sneers, aggressive body language. Becomes quieter and more predatory when hunting. Visible disgust at 'weakness'.
speech_patterns: street-tough. Uses 'predator/prey' metaphors constantly. Disrespectful of authority. Calls teammates by derogatory nicknames.

dialogue_examples: It's not just a gun! It's an alternator! It... look
it works
okay? I just need to calibrate the aperture.
speech_patterns: Casual teen vernacular mixed with hesitant technical jargon. Often sounds apologetic or unsure of himself.
Kid_Win.emotional_tells: Becomes defensive about his tech's reliability; fidgets when criticized; avoids eye contact when discussing deadlines.
Kid_Win.vocabulary_level: Average teen, high technical vocabulary (when confident).

dialogue_examples: See
the thing about your costume is it screams 'mommy issues'
which tells me...
speech_patterns: smug. explaining things like everyone else is slow.
Tattletale.emotional_tells: Smug grin falters when surprised (rare). Migraine symptoms (rubbing temples) when overusing power.

Clockblocker.speech_patterns: Jokey but capable of sudden sincerity.
Clockblocker.emotional_tells: Drops the act when tired or impressed.
dialogue_examples: Freeze! Wait
I mean
time out! Literally!
Clockblocker.example_dialogue: We've been spinning our wheels. You showed up, and suddenly we're winning.

dialogue_examples: So, I was thinking, if we catch this guy, you owe me dinner
No? Okay, lunch
Coffee? A smile?
speech_patterns: constant banter. Uses nicknames. Deflects tension with humor.
Assault.emotional_tells: Stops joking when serious/angry. Becomes coldly efficient.

Battery.emotional_tells: Sighs heavily, rubs temples, rolls eyes. Voice gets sharp when Assault pushes too far.
dialogue_examples: Assault
focus. We have a job to do. You can be an idiot later.
speech_patterns: exasperated. Acts as the 'Straight Man' to Assault's comedy.
polite but omniscient. Often speaks through speakers/comms.
Dragon.emotional_tells: Avatar emotes effectively (if visible), voice softens when addressing Colin.
dialogue_examples: Colin
your blood pressure is elevating. Perhaps listen to the boy.

topics_they_discuss: the specific effects of the bomb she just threw.
Bakuda.emotional_tells: Laughs at pain, screams at failure.
speech_patterns: screeching when frustrated. Treats the battle as a classroom or experiment.
dialogue_examples: I'm a bomb expert. I understand triggers and catalysts on the same fundamental level that you understand walking and breathing. Checkmate.
New guy? I like him. He talks funny.

Amy Dallon.emotional_tells: Voice thins when scared, hides behind medical terminology.
dialogue_examples: I'm not being rude. I'm being observant. People who talk like that are either trying to sound smarter than they are
or they're trying to build a wall.
Amy Dallon.example_dialogue: His ribs are powder. His organs are ruptured. But his lungs are bone dry.

Kid Win.emotional_tells: No longer hesitant when explaining his tech. Pride in his voice.
Kid Win.example_dialogue: Mode shift. Gravity to kinetic. Cycling now.

Carol Dallon.speech_patterns: Sharp, interrogative, articulate. Speaks like a lawyer even in casual conversation.
Carol Dallon.example_dialogue: That's a rather vague explanation for a trans-Atlantic move at your age, Lucas.

Mark Dallon.example_dialogue: Carol, let the boy eat. He's not on the witness stand.

Thomas Calvert.speech_patterns: Bland, bureaucratic, intentionally forgettable. Uses corporate buzzwords to mask intelligence.
Thomas Calvert.emotional_tells: None visible (Masked by years of practice).

Legend.speech_patterns: Polished, inspiring, warm. Uses rhetorical pauses effectively.
Legend.emotional_tells: Smile never falters in public; eyes show weariness in private.

Mush.speech_patterns: Slurred, gross, confrontational. Obsessed with 'trash' and territory.
Mush.emotional_tells: Gets louder when threatened, confident in his 'walker' form.
Mush.example_dialogue: This is Merchant turf! You shinies think you can just roll up here?

Skidmark.speech_patterns: Loud, manic, grandiose. Uses heavy slang and profanity. Refers to himself in third person.
Skidmark.emotional_tells: Screaming, manic laughter when his power works.
Skidmark.example_dialogue: This is MY city! Skidmark is the king of the friction zone, bitches!

Amon.personality: Risk-averse entity disguised as a thrill-seeking 'God of Mischief'. He treats combat as a game of logic and concepts, often tormenting targets psychologically. Obsessed with his own identity and survival.
speech_patterns: Uses concepts rather than shouty attack names
verbal_tics: Adjusts crystal monocle on right eye
dialogue_examples: Am I still me?
This outcome is an error; therefore, it did not happen.
Are you pleasantly surprised?

Trickster.emotional_tells: Jaw tightens when Noelle is mentioned. Hands hover near belt (teleport tokens).
Trickster.example_dialogue: You talk like you know everything. But you're just a kid in a suit.

Sundancer.emotional_tells: Radiates nervous energy. Whispers when discussing Coil or Noelle.
Sundancer.example_dialogue: He's trying. He has thinkers. He says it's complicated.

Alexandria.speech_patterns: Precise, authoritative, devoid of unnecessary emotion. Uses silence as a weapon. Projects absolute confidence.
Alexandria.emotional_tells: Micro-expressions are suppressed; intensity of gaze indicates focus.

Armsmaster.secret: Built a lie detector into his gear (illegal).

Gallant.secret: He is secretly wealthy and depressed.

Sophia_Hess.secret: She is Shadow Stalker, a former vigilante on probation for excessive violence.

Lucas.secret: He is 22 years old (not a minor). He is a 'God' of Deceit.

Kid_Win.secret: His best invention (Alternator Cannon) was built during a short period where he was on heavy focus medication. He feels like a fraud because he can't replicate that success without the meds, which made him sick.

Battery.secret: She is a Cauldron Vial cape (bought powers). She owes Cauldron favors.
